title.narrative: Strengthening IOM's Field Support in Emergency Preparedness and Response

description.narrative: Global phenomena such as rapid population growth and urbanization, persistent poverty and socio-economic inequality, and the growing number of natural disasters, protracted and complex crises have continued to increase the amount of humanitarian needs worldwide. As the UN’s migration agency, IOM has a unique role to play in responding to the needs of people who are displaced, vulnerable to or affected by these phenomena. Like most humanitarian organizations, however, IOM’s approaches to assistance - and the underlying processes that support these approaches - must continuously be reviewed and reframed, and the organization’s capacity must be strengthened in order to reflect the ever-changing environment and needs on the ground. IOM aims to enhance its preparedness and surge capacity to respond in a principled, effective, efficient, and accountable manner while assisting and protecting the most vulnerable populations affected and displaced by natural disasters and conflict.
